="preserve">The lowest common denominator (also least common denominator and LCD) is the least common multiple of the denominators (bottom parts) of a group of fractions. It makes it easier to add, subtract, and compare fractions.
The LCD of formula_1 and formula_1 is 6. This is because formula_1 and formula_1 equal formula_1 and formula_1. 6 is the smallest number that can be at the bottom of both of those fractions.
